subject: Re: [junit] question about Assert.assertEquals
msgSnippet: ... equals signature is Object, so it needs to be: public boolean equals(Object pt) { if (! pt instanceof Point) { return false; } else { ... } -Kevin
messageBody:
I don't think you're actually overriding equals in your class:

> public class Point {
>
> public boolean equals(Point pt){
> return (x== pt.x && y == pt.y);
> }
>

equals' signature is Object, so it needs to be:

public boolean equals(Object pt) {
if (! pt instanceof Point) {
return false;
} else {
...
}



-Kevin
